item.title: Good Code is Boring
item.description: You have seen them many times. Small snippets of code and the question “What would the the following piece of code print” beneath. You might have tried taking a guess, and perhaps, even failed. {{ twitter “865159346149314560”}} I find those kinds of questions utterly pointless. They not only teach you nothing about real-world programming, but might also lead many newcomers to long-term frustration with programming. All programming languages have baggage - obscure features that made it in the spec but were later deemed as hacks that should be avoided.
